evidence.text: On any given day or night, hundreds of individuals in Grants Pass, Oregon are forced to live outside due to the lack of emergency shelter and affordable housing in their community. The most recent “point in time” count in Josephine County found 654 individuals on the street and another 1011 individuals precariously housed for a total of 1754 people who are homeless or at immediate risk of homelessness.
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Grants Pass faces a severe affordable housing crisis with no emergency shelter, resulting in hundreds of individuals forced to live outside daily due to lack of affordable housing and emergency shelter options.

evidence.text: The City has removed park benches from its parks. The City has refused to allow warming stations in the winter (which are very cold), and cooling stations in the summer (which are very hot and increasingly smoky). The City has paid one-way bus fare for homeless people to leave town. One city councilor stated in a city council meeting, “the point is to make it uncomfortable enough for them [homeless people] in our city so they will want to move on down the road.”
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City of Grants Pass has implemented policies to drive homeless people out of town, including removing park benches, refusing warming/cooling centers, offering one-way bus fare, and enacting restrictive ordinances targeting homeless individuals.

evidence.text: Plaintiff Debra Blake has been repeatedly awakened by Grants Pass police while sleeping and told she must move along. She has been cited for violations including sleeping in an alley and prohibited camping, resulting in fines totaling over $2000. Plaintiff Gloria Johnson has been ticketed for camping in parks while sleeping in her van, and Plaintiff John Logan has been ordered to move along while sleeping in his truck.
evidence.source_document: Third Amended Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Plaintiffs Debra Blake, Gloria Johnson, and John Logan have each experienced repeated enforcement of anti-camping and anti-sleeping ordinances leading to fines, arrests, and criminal prosecution for involuntary homelessness.
